articles.description: Thomas Tuchel is poised to commit to two more years as England manager, which will take him through to Euro 2028.
articles.title: Thomas Tuchel: England manager set to sign two-year extension

articles.description: Ukrainian skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych is banned from competing at the Winter Olympics for continuing to wear a helmet which features images of athletes killed during Russia's invasion of his home country.
articles.title: IOC bans Ukrainian skeleton pilot Vladyslav Heraskevych over 'helmet of remembrance'

articles.description: Follow live text, BBC coverage, radio commentary, reaction and updates of medals and results from Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina.
articles.title: Winter Olympics 2026 LIVE: Day six - watch BBC - medals, results, TV stream & updates from Milan-Cortina

articles.description: All the latest reaction as Nottingham Forest sack Sean Dyche and look to appoint their fourth manager of the season.
articles.title: Sean Dyche sacked: Nottingham Forest sack Dyche and in talks with Pereira

articles.description: Trent Alexander-Arnold endured a difficult start at Real Madrid but his prospects are looking up - and it might earn him a ticket to the World Cup.
articles.title: Trent Alexander-Arnold's Real Madrid and England future analysed

articles.description: Promoter Eddie Hearn "expects" Anthony Joshua to fight again following the death of two close friends - but admits there are no "guarantees".
articles.title: Eddie Hearn 'expects' Anthony Joshua to fight again after crash

articles.description: Sir Keir Starmer said comments by the businessman and Manchester United co-owner were "offensive and wrong".
articles.title: PM tells Sir Jim Ratcliffe to apologise for saying UK 'colonised by immigrants'

articles.description: Nottingham Forest sack Sean Dyche as head coach after less than four months in charge and are looking for their fourth boss of the season.
articles.title: Sean Dyche sacked by Nottingham Forest with club in relegation fight

articles.description: Pep Guardiola vowed his Manchester City side would "breathe down the neck of Arsenal" as they aim to hunt down the Premier League leaders in this fascinating title race.
articles.title: Man City 3-0 Fulham: Pep Guardiola's side close in on leaders Arsenal

articles.description: Captain Harry Brook says England's batters were "too careful" in their 30-run defeat by West Indies at the T20 World Cup.
articles.title: T20 World Cup: England batters too 'careful' in defeat by West Indies, says Harry Brook
